column4: Ex0r, I've been told that the ndiswrapper in the repositories are old
Really old
Anyway, I just ran lsusb, will it give me the name of the chipset or drivers I need?
For my wireless card
Hey everyone
Using ndiswrapper, it says that my drivers are installed
for wusb54gs v2
ok does it say hardware present also?
yep your wireless hardware is working
depends if you setup networkmanager or not to use the device but the blinking part depends
what does ifconfig -a show
lo and what?
did the modprobe error out or anything
No, it all went fine
ok do this dmesg|less and see if it sayds anyhting about usb you might have to find out what device name it gave it
ok, one second
depends on the chipset
but most intel would work
what laptop is this if that's what your on what is the processor of it?
this is a Dell latitude with a P2
I think I've made up my mind to ditch the linksys card and buy a $20 network card off of newegg that is known to work
